utterances: Let's see if we get some callers in on the conversation.
We're talking with Martin Clunes, a British actor who mispronounces his own name and...
Oh, everybody else asks me this.
Well, you know, we can hang on to this, this will they/won't they scenario for as long as - well, not indefinitely, I'm afraid.
But we'll keep hanging on in there.
We've just shot, finished shooting the fifth series which I am at liberty to tell you contains their child, the poor baby.
Yeah, when we had the baby there.
Well, he's with us throughout the series.

So that kind of - you know, that alter things for them because just before the - they had the baby, they kind of reached the decision that, you know, love each other, though they kind of seem to, they just can't live with one another.
And - but having the baby really throws them back together and rekindles that.
But you know, not a - they're not a normal couple.
And it would be - it wouldn't our show if the course of love ran true and freely.
Sylvia, thanks very much for the call.
Listeners may also remember you as one of the lead character in another TV series, ""Men Behaving Badly."" It is, though, hard to imagine characters more different than Gary Strang and Doc Martin.
For one thing, Doc Martin falls dead asleep after just a couple of glasses of wine.
And Gary could drink a few.
Ah, yeah, he liked - yeah, he did like a few.
We can hear that your character is not very much like Doc Martin.
Is your character a little bit more like the...
Somewhere between the two, it's a scary thought, isn't it.
I mean, you know, I had a go it at the appropriate time.
But the thing about ""Men Behaving Badly"" was that it was kind of at the inappropriate time.
They were, you know, both in their 20s and they should have got that stuff out their system.
And sort of in eternal adolescence.
And people say, you know, is there any chance of, you know, you remaking that show and picking up the story?
No, you think, my god, how seedy.
It's hard to imagine what they have done after all this...
It would take on a real...
Let's go next to Bryan(ph), and Bryan with us from Bordentown in New Jersey.
I guess my question is, I've stayed in the town that is called Portwenn, it was before your last season was being filmed and just...
So I'd like to know, when the crew descends upon there...
...I guess block off streets for filming and - is there a - is there a happiness (unintelligible) many years?
There's - I mean, it is a mixed blessing having a crew - you know, a film crew in your town.

I mean, the actual crew, the filming of it, can be quite obstructive, but it's worse for - it's worse - I mean, you'll have noticed there's a bottleneck down the hill where cars just reach an impasse and can't get pass one another.
And there's an unwritten law that if you're a certain way down the hill, you have to give right to whoever's coming uphill or whatever.
And nobody knows that unwritten law, and most of the people going through there are visitors, so it's a real mess.
When we're there, we're actually marshalling the traffic.
Last March, we walked the closed(ph) path.
What's the name of the actual village, Bryan?
